title: Problem 5
content:
(20 points)
Given are pairs of cognate words of two closely related languages—Turkish and Tatar. Some words have been left out:

| Turkish            | Tatar           | Translation       |
|--------------------|-----------------|-------------------|
| bandır             | mandır          | dip!              |
| yelken             | cilkän          | sail              |
| onuncu             | unınçı          | tenth             |
| baytar             | baytar          | vet               |
| yi%irmi            | yegerme         | twenty            |
| bencil             | minçel          | selfish           |
| güreş              | köräş           | wrestling         |
| işlesem            | eşläsäm         | if I work         |
| büyük              | böyek           | great             |
| yıldırım           | yıldırım        | lightning         |
| bunda              | monda           | in this, here     |
| yetiştir           | citeşter        | convey!           |
| gö%er              | kügär           | become blue!      |
| bozacı             | buzaçı          | boza handler      |
| gerekli            | kiräkle         | necessary         |
| boyun              | muyın           | neck              |
| uzun               | ozın            | long              |
| yöneliş            | yünäleş         | direction         |
|                    | osta            | master            |
|                    | küzänäk         | pore              |
|                    | yılan           | snake             |
| yedişer            |                 | seven each        |
| bilezik            |                 | bracelet          |
| üstünde            |                 | on top of         |
| bin                |                 | mount!            |
| yumru              |                 | lump, swelling    |

§§. Fill the gaps.

Notes: The letters ä, ı, ö, ü stand for specific vowels (the first two are not unlike the ones in cat and bird, respectively), 
while % is a specific Turkish consonant; c, ç, ş, y are pronounced as the initial consonants in jet, chip, ship, yet.
Boza is a weakly alcoholic drink made from millet. Editors:
Ivan Derzhanski
---

Good luck!
